name: market for bell pepper | bell pepper | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7733/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'bell pepper', in the Global geography.;In this market, default transport model and expert judgement was used to develop product specific transport distance estimations.;The default transport distances are built on a generic model which assigns the transport distances based on the ISIC code. This approach is, especially in case of fruits and vegetables, rather coarse. So in a certain cases expert judgement is used to adjust the default distances.;;The transport distances and associated impacts presented in the markets represents the average scenario for given geography. In case of fruits and vegetables the final impact at the consumer vary a lot depending on whether the food is consumed near the producer or far. The average impact of, for example, banana is overestimated if the consumer is present in Brazil and it is heavily underestimated is the consumer is present in Europe. The markets are modelled so, that editing to model concrete scenario is possible and easy.;;Fruits and vegetables are traded all over the world on an increasing scale.;It is assumed, that all green bell peppers which are transported are being transported by infrastructure equipped for transport of goods in need of atmosphere control.;;The recomended conditions for transport of green bell peppers are (Hamburg Sud, 2013, Stay cool, We care); temperature: +7 to +10Â°C, ventilation: 10 to 15 m3/h, humidity (relative); 90 to 95 %, approximate shelf life (in ambient air): 2 to 3 weeks.;The product 'bell pepper' is a spice/aromatic crop. It is a perennial crop.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'bell pepper',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'bell pepper',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are considered.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value.

The reefer operates (is cooling or freezing down the goods) no matter if it is being transported or if it is standing in a port or farm and not moving. The amount of operation of reefer needed is connected directly to different modes of transport using default assumptions on the average speed of the infrastructure.

This exchange represents the time, when the reefer is being transferred from one mode of the transport to another. So for example the reefer is taken by a truck to the port, where it is transferred to a transoceanic ship. During this time the transport vehicles are not moving, but the reefer keeps operating and maintaining the required atmosphere.

Based on an estimate 20% of amount of operation, reefer, cooling is added to cover the time when the reefer is transferred between different types of transport.  So, for example, if the goods stay and is being transported by the different modes of transport for 10 days there are 2 more days added that represent the time when the reefer is being transferred from the truck to the ship and from the ship to the train, etc.

flow.name: operation, reefer, cooling

exchanges.description:
Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. 

It is estimated (based on production volumes), that 90% of the transport by lorry is by big lorries which carry a reefer and 10% by small lorries with build in refrigeration machine.
